problem.markdown:
We are trying to find a student in an unsorted list of student names. The list has length N. What's the worst-case running time as a function of the size of N? ( ) Constant ( ) Logarithmic (x) Linear ( ) Quadratic ( ) Exponential
[explanation] In the worst case, the student you are looking for is at the end of the list and so we have to look at all N students, and for each student, only do "1" amount of work (see if they're the student or not). So overall, it's 1*N work, which is linear. [explanation]
problem.p: We are trying to find a student in an unsorted list of student names. The list has length N. What's the worst-case running time as a function of the size of N?

div.p: In the worst case, the student you are looking for is at the end of the list and so we have to look at all N students, and for each student, only do "1" amount of work (see if they're the student or not). So overall, it's 1*N work, which is linear.
